ygData.subject: RE: Gargoyle Island in OOT
ygData.msgSnippet: ...  Yay! I m glad you had a good experience with the gargs. It is nice that they do indeed run the same speed you do. Since I usually turned circles on
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Peck White <PWhite@...>
>
> About a week ago there was a discussion about the gargoyles in OOT and
> whether a level 22 Bard could solo them. I expressed the
> opinion that it
> would be unlikely based on my own experiences at level 23.
> The thread also
> discussed whether Selo's could be successfully used on the island. I
> expressed the opinion that it would cause too much damage
> because of the
> rough terrain. I was wrong on both counts. Let me tell you
> how I found out
> I was wrong.

<snip>

Yay! I'm glad you had a good experience with the gargs. It is nice that they
do indeed run the same speed you do. Since I usually turned circles on one
side of the island, I usually used selo's, but that was mainly because I
hated always changing my views when running around the island.

Once you get around 25 or so, you shouldn't have to kite as much, but it's
always nice to know you can if you have to. The all instrument attack is
also useful for clearing 3 skels at a time to open the garg spawns. The only
annoying thing was that OOT used to have lots of rain and this was before
they extended how far you can see. I'd expect it's much better now.

Windleaf
